attributes.additional_details:
I want parliament to contact denbighshire county council and to make them provide another park as soon as possible within the local area so Children can play outdoors and are not stuck behind a screen. This was our only accessible park that was disability friendly. That many children from the local area used. Including holidaymakers.

Park needs replacing asap, this was an outlet for local children whom many of live in flats with no gardens, Children with extra needs also use this park often as its accessible.
attributes.background: Childrens play park has been demolished by denbighshire council, area is now being used for sea defence veichles and materials. No other local park within walking distance that is disability friendly.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local amenities are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
